conclusion: The task is to determine which objects A will collide with and where A will eventually stop based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
Toy Car A starts in the lower right corner, moving to the left.
Objects on the plane include a green cube (upper center), blue cube (upper center-right), red cube (center-left), yellow cube (center), and blue sphere (center).
A moves towards the blue sphere in the center based on its initial trajectory.
A will likely collide with the blue sphere due to its current trajectory.
The collision with the blue sphere will result in a deflection of A based on the angle and force of impact.
After hitting the blue sphere, A may deflect upwards or upwards-right.
Depending on the angle, A might move towards the yellow cube or continue upward towards the blue cube or green cube.
If deflected upwards, A could potentially hit the yellow cube.
A is likely to lose energy with each collision due to friction on the green surface and its initial power.
A might stop near the yellow cube if enough energy remains after the initial collision.
If energy is significantly reduced, A might stop near the blue sphere after the first collision.
A will first collide with the blue sphere and may then stop near the yellow cube.
